intro: Eugenia prenleloupii, commonly known as the Prenleloupii guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
